info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 23 at 5:55AM MST until February 25 at 5:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THIS MORNING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO NOON MST FRIDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON FRIDAY THROUGH 5 PM MST SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 40 to 50 below zero. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 20 to 40 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, widespread blowing and drifting snow possible. Winds could gust as high as 70 mph. * WHERE...The Rocky Mountain Front and adjacent foothills and plains. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 11 AM MST this morning. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 11 AM this morning to Noon MST Friday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from noon Friday through 5 pm MST Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes. Significant reductions in visibility, slippery roads, and partial to full lane blockages possible Friday afternoon through late Saturday afternoon due to blowing and drifting of existing snow cover. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Widespread impacts from blowing and drifting snow possible Friday afternoon through late Saturday afternoon. Potential impacts include road closures due to snow drifts blocking traffic and whiteout conditions at times.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
